page.title: 02"Bowcombe"-Bowcombe Farm.
page.content: {Bowcombe Farm}is one of two farms owned in partnership by two brothers, comprising about 1250 acres, of which about half is in Bowcombe. A record of a farm at Bowcombe can be found in the original{Domesday Book.}The acreage is almost equally divided between arable land and cultivated grassland to support 1000 sheep and 450 cattle. The arable land is divided between Spring and Winter crops such as barley and wheat. Beans and peas are also grown, as is grass for pasturage and silage for Winter feed. {While fifty years ago 30 to 40 men {were needed to work this acreage, with {modern machinery and farming {techniques only 6 full time workers {are employed.}Major seasonal tasks such as hay-making and sheep shearing may be done by contract to speciallist agricultural firms.
